Bayern Munich : Wenger, le favori ?
Ars√®ne Wenger serait le favori pour remplacer Niko Kovac sur le banc du Bayern Munich.
06 Nov 2019, 11:01 by Hugo Deloraine



12 octobre 1996 - Blackburn Rovers-Arsenal (0-2)Alors qu'on √©voque Johan Cruyff sur le banc des Gunners, un inconnu ou presque en provenance du club japonais de Nagoya Grampus est nomm√©. Ars√®ne Wenger pass√© par Monaco, prend place sur le banc d'Arsenal et bat Blackburn gr√¢ce √† un doubl√© de Ian Wright.Lire aussi : clap de fin pour Ars√®ne Wenger √† ArsenalIcon Sport



17 mai 1998 - Finale de la Cup, Arsenal-Newcaste (2-0)Au terme de sa deuxi√®me saison √† la t√™te d'Arsenal, Wenger r√©alise le doubl√©. Sacr√©s champions de Premier League, un point devant Manchester United, les Gunners encha√Ænent en remportant la Cup, une semaine plus tard, aux d√©pens de Newcastle (2-0).Icon Sport



17 mai 2000 - Finale de Coupe de l'UEFA, Arsenal-Galatasaray (0-0, 1-4 tab)Quatre ans, apr√®s son arriv√©e, Ars√®ne Wenger a l'occasion de remporter un premier troph√©e europ√©en. En C3, contre Galatasaray, les Gunners s'effondrent apr√®s 120 minutes vierges. ≈†uker et Vieira craquent pendant la s√©ance de tirs.Icon Sport



8 mai 2002 - Premier League, Manchester United-Arsenal (0-1)Au terme d'une fin de saison √† suspens, Arsenal remporte la FA Cup contre Chelsea (2-0) et encha√Æne quatre jours plus tard sur la pelouse du grand Manchester United de Sir Alex Ferguson. Vainqueur √† l'ext√©rieur, Ars√®ne Wenger s'offre son deuxi√®me titre de champion d'Angleterre.Icon Sport



15 mai 2004 - Premier League, Arsenal-Leicester City (2-1)C‚Äôest l‚Äôann√©e des Invincibles. En plus d‚Äô√™tre sacr√© pour la troisi√®me fois en Premier League, l‚Äôancien Mon√©gasque termine la saison invaincu. S√ªrement l'apog√©e de sa carri√®re √† Arsenal.Icon Sport



7 mai 2006 - Premier League, Arsenal-Hull City (4-2)Apr√®s 10 ans au club, Wenger dispute son dernier match √† Highbury avant le d√©m√©nagement √† l‚ÄôEmirates Stadium. Une √©motion partag√©e, comme souvent, avec Thierry Henry.Icon Sport



17 mai 2006 - Finale de Ligue des champions, Barcelone-Arsenal (2-1)Apr√®s avoir √©limin√© le Real Madrid, la Juventus et Villarreal, les Gunners affrontent Barcelone au Stade de France. La partie bascule quand Jens Lehmann fauche Samuel Eto'o et est exclu apr√®s 18 minutes de jeu. Eto'o et Juliano Belletti emp√™chent ensuite Ars√®ne Wenger de remporter un premier titre europ√©en.Icon Sport



9 janvier 2012 - FA Cup, Arsenal-Leeds (1-0)Alors que tout le monde pensait termin√©e la relation entre Thierry Henry et Arsenal, Ars√®ne Wenger annonce le 6 janvier 2012 le retour de la l√©gende pour une pige de 2 mois. Thierry Henry refoule la pelouse de l'Emirates contre Leeds et √† la 77e minute, le frenchie d√©livre les fans en inscrivant l‚Äôunique but de la rencontre. Un but c√©l√©br√© dans les bras du coach alsacien.Icon Sport



Mai 2014, 2015 et 2017 - FA CupA d√©faut de gagner en championnat, Arsenal brille en coupe. En quatre ans, les Gunners s‚Äôoffrent trois titres en FA Cup pour le plus grand plaisir d‚ÄôArs√®ne Wenger.Icon Sport



18 mars 2017 - Premier League, West Brom - Arsenal (3-1)Dans le Ciel de West Bromwich, un avion affiche un message repris par les fans des Gunners depuis plusieurs semaines : "Wenger out". Apr√®s plus de 20 ans, la relation entre les supporters et l'Alsacien s'est passablement d√©t√©rior√©e.Icon Sport

Arsenal | La carri√®re d'Ars√®ne Wenger en 10 dates




Selon le journal allemand Bild, g√©n√©ralement bien inform√©, l'ancien coach d'Arsenal, Ars√®ne Wenger serait le grand favori pour remplacer Niko Kovac sur le banc du Bayern depuis que ce dernier ait¬†annonc√© sa d√©mission le week-end dernier. Uli Hoeness a pourtant annonc√© qu'il se donnait un d√©lais de trois semaines pour trouver l'entra√Æneur id√©al mais il semblerait que les choses avancent vite.




Wenger, jusqu'√† la fin de saison uniquement ?




Le groupe bavarois+10 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

Toujours selon le m√©dia allemand, l'Alsacien pourrait se retrouver sur le banc bavarois jusqu'√† la fin de la saison permettant ainsi au club du Bayern de se pencher sur une solution sur le long terme par la suite. Le nom d' Erik ten Hag (entra√Æneur de l'Ajax Amsterdam) fait parti de ceux qui reviennent r√©guli√®rement. Affaire √† suivre.

text:
Bundesliga
Bayern Munich: Wenger, the favorite?
Arsene Wenger would be the favorite to replace Niko Kovac on the bench of Bayern Munich.
06 Nov 2019, 11:01 by Hugo Deloraine



October 12, 1996 - Blackburn Rovers-Arsenal (0-2) While Johan Cruyff is mentioned on the Gunner's Bench, an unknown or almost unknown from the Japanese Nagoya Grampus club is named. Arsene Wenger passed by Monaco, takes place on the bench of Arsenal and beats Blackburn thanks to a doubled of Ian Wright.Read also: end clapper for Ars√®ne Wenger at ArsenalIcon Sport



May 17, 1998 - Cup Final, Arsenal-Newcaste (2-0) At the end of his second season at the head of Arsenal, Wenger achieves the double. Sacred Premier League champions, one point ahead of Manchester United, the Gunners go on to win the Cup, a week later, at the expense of Newcastle (2-0) .Icon Sport



17 May 2000 - UEFA Cup Final, Arsenal-Galatasaray (0-0, 1-4 tab) Four years after his arrival, Ars√®ne Wenger has the opportunity to win a first European trophy. In C3, against Galatasaray, the Gunners collapse after 120 minutes virgins. ≈†uker and Vieira crack during the shooting session.Icon Sport



May 8, 2002 - Premier League, Manchester United-Arsenal (0-1) After an end to the season, Arsenal won the FA Cup against Chelsea (2-0) and chained four days later on the lawn of the big Manchester United from Sir Alex Ferguson. Winner outside, Arsene Wenger offers his second title of champion of England.Icon Sport



May 15, 2004 - Premier League, Arsenal-Leicester City (2-1) This is the year of the Invincibles. In addition to being crowned for the third time in the Premier League, the former Monegasque ends the undefeated season. Surely the pinnacle of his career at Arsenal.Icon Sport



May 7, 2006 - Premier League, Arsenal-Hull City (4-2) After 10 years at the club, Wenger played his last match in Highbury before moving to Emirates Stadium. A shared emotion, as often, with Thierry Henry.Icon Sport



May 17, 2006 - Champions League final, Barcelona-Arsenal (2-1) After eliminating Real Madrid, Juventus and Villarreal, the Gunners face Barcelona at the Stade de France. The game changes when Jens Lehmann mows Samuel Eto'o and is excluded after 18 minutes of play. Eto'o and Juliano Belletti then prevent Ars√®ne Wenger from winning a first European title.Icon Sport



January 9, 2012 - FA Cup, Arsenal-Leeds (1-0) While everyone thought the relationship between Thierry Henry and Arsenal was over, Ars√®ne Wenger announced on January 6, 2012 the return of the legend for a draw of 2 months. Thierry Henry pushes the Emirates against Leeds and in the 77th minute, the frenchie delivers the fans by scoring the only goal of the match. A goal celebrated in the arms of the Alsatian coach.Icon Sport



May 2014, 2015 and 2017 - FA CupA failing to win in the league, Arsenal shines in cut. In four years, the Gunners are offering three FA Cup titles to the great pleasure of Ars√®ne Wenger.Icon Sport



March 18, 2017 - Premier League, West Brom - Arsenal (3-1) In the Sky of West Bromwich, a plane displays a message taken by fans of the Gunners for several weeks: "Wenger out". After more than 20 years, the relationship between the fans and the Alsatian has deteriorated considerably.

Arsenal | Ars√®ne Wenger's career in 10 dates




According to the German newspaper Bild, which is generally well informed, former Arsenal coach Arsene Wenger would be the big favorite to replace Niko Kovac on Bayern's bench since Bayern announced his resignation last weekend. Uli Hoeness, however, announced that he gave himself a three-week deadline to find the ideal coach but it seems that things are moving quickly.




Wenger, until the end of the season only?




Bavarian group + 10 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

Still according to the German media, the Alsatian could end up on the Bavarian bench until the end of the season allowing the club Bayern to look into a solution in the long term thereafter. The name of Erik ten Hag (coach of Ajax Amsterdam) is among those who come back regularly. Case to follow.
